sentences.english: The two companies settled out of court.
sentences.chinese: 這兩家公司在庭外和解了。

sentences.english: They settled the case out of court .
sentences.chinese: 他們的案子在庭外和解了。

sentences.english: He said he had 'no intention' of negotiating an out-of-court settlement.
sentences.chinese: 他說，他“無意”協商庭外調解。

sentences.english: Out-of-court settlement is specially appropriate as applied to disputes that are resolved instituting litigation.
sentences.chinese: 庭外調解專門適用於沒有起訴的爭端之解決。

sentences.english: Chien displayed no emotion when his sentencing was announced. His relatives cried outside the court house.
sentences.chinese: 阮文海聆判後面無表情，他的親戚則在庭外痛哭。

sentences.english: Ultimately his suit was settled out of court.
sentences.chinese: 他的訟訴案是在庭外解決的。

sentences.english: Their lawyers advised them to settle out of court.
sentences.chinese: 他們的律師都勸告他們庭外和解。

sentences.english: They settled the quarrel out of court.
sentences.chinese: 他們以庭外和解的方式解決了爭端。

sentences.english: Last night beyond pavilions sad song seemed rising, Was it the souls of flowers or birds that were singing?
sentences.chinese: 昨宵庭外悲歌奏，知是花魂與鳥魂？

sentences.english: They are hoping to reach an out-of-court settlement.
The child molestation case was settled out of court with Jackson reportedly paying the boy millions of dollars.
sentences.chinese: 孌童案達成庭外和解與傑克遜據說男孩百萬美元支付。

sentences.english: Many civil cases can be settled out of court.
sentences.chinese: 很多民事案件都可以在庭外解決。

sentences.english: North of the front gate, a great courtyard lies beyond five marble bridges.
sentences.chinese: 在正門的北方，在巨大的中庭外是五座大理石橋。

sentences.english: The two sides settled the dispute out of court in 2005.
sentences.chinese: 雙方於2005年以庭外調解的方式解決了糾紛。

sentences.english: "This court settlement signals the death knell for mercury fillings, " Brown predicted.
sentences.chinese: 這個庭外和解敲響了汞填充物的喪鐘。

sentences.english: They decided to drop the charges against the newspaper and settle out of court.
sentences.chinese: 他們決定撤銷對那家報紙的指控，在庭外和解。

definition: examination of the evidence of the opposing party in a court of law
another case (in law)/a case to treat separately
to make a formal request/formal request/to make a claim (law)
